availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Anderson County farmer. Kentucky native. Married Matilda Watts Yeates in 1833. Father of Mary E. Yeates. Held eight slaves in 1860.

bibl.p: KYR-0001-029-0565. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Anderson County, p. 225. Kentucky, Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 101. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 60. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 12. Yates Publishing, U.S. and International Marriage Records, 1560-1900, Ancestry, Kentucky, 1833, source no 9721.000. “Enoch Yeates,” Find A Grave, September 7, 2011, memorial no. 76126968 (accessed May 7, 2017).
